title: COCOBOD allegedly procures 4 Land Cruisers, 110 pickups amid turmoil over failure to pay farmers
desc: The Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD) has allegedly procured a number of vehicles despite the current challenges faced by the board in paying farmers from whom it has purchased cocoa beans.

title: NASA will now allow astronauts to take their smartphones to space
desc: NASA astronauts can now take their personal phones with them to space.

title: It Turns Out Waymos Are Being Controlled by Workers in the Philippines
desc: During a Congressional hearing, Waymo's chief safety officer, Mauricio Peña, was grilled over the company's reliance on overseas workers.

title: London to get £1.5bn share of housing loan scheme
desc: Housing associations can take out low interest rate loans to build homes across the capital.

title: Fantasy Premier League: Gameweek 25 Q&A with expert Gianni Buttice - send us your questions
desc: Get all your Fantasy Premier League gameweek 25 tips and team news before Friday's deadline and send your questions to FPL expert Gianni Buttice.

title: Shinedown Drop Off Rock the Country Festival
desc: Shinedown dropped off the Rock the Country festival in February 2026 — shortly after their drummer criticized Ludacris for doing the same.

title: Graham Norton joins star cast of Taylor Swift's new video
desc: The video for Opalite was inspired by Norton's chat show, after Swift appeared on the sofa last year.

title: Keith Duffy says Boyzone wasn’t offered an Irish stadium for upcoming reunion
desc: The band will play two shows at London’s Emirates Stadium this summer but Duffy said they weren’t offered a stadium in Ireland.

title: Personalize your vivo X300 Series with Flip Cards
desc: Cameras might be their main focus for vivo X300 Series owners, but it's the lock screen that usually gets the most amount of viewership.

title: Pakistan Blast Live Updates: Suspicion Likely To Fall On Pak Taliban, Islamic State
desc: At least 69 people were killed, and 169 were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad.
